summary.para: Identifies the activation context for the current application. This class cannot be inherited.

content.para: The T:System.ActivationContext class contains an T:System.ApplicationIdentity and provides internal-only access to the application manifest. The activation context is used during manifest-based activation to set up the domain policy and provide an application-based security model. For more information, see the T:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityManager class.

relatedTopics.link: ClickOnce Deployment for Windows Forms Applications

summary.para: Gets the application identity for the current application.

returnValue.para: An T:System.ApplicationIdentity object that identifies the current application.

content.para: An T:System.ApplicationIdentity uniquely identifies an application by its full name and location.

summary.para: Releases all resources used by the T:System.ActivationContext.

content.para: Call M:System.ActivationContext.Dispose when you are finished using the T:System.ActivationContext. The M:System.ActivationContext.Dispose method leaves the T:System.ActivationContext in an unusable state. After calling M:System.ActivationContext.Dispose, you must release all references to the T:System.ActivationContext so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the T:System.ActivationContext was occupying. For more information, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Implementing a Dispose Method.

alert.para: Always call M:System.ActivationContext.Dispose before you release your last reference to the T:System.ActivationContext. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the T:System.ActivationContext object's Finalize method.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ActivationContext class.
Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ActivationContext class using the specified application identity.

content.para: An T:System.ApplicationIdentity object that identifies an application.
applicationIdentity is null.
No deployment or application identity is specified in applicationIdentity.

The M:System.ActivationContext.CreatePartialActivationContext(System.ApplicationIdentity) method calls an internal constructor to create a new activation context. The implementation of the T:System.ActivationContext class in the .NET Framework version 2.0 is designed for applications that are neither fully installed in a store nor fully contained a folder. This method provides backward compatibility for later releases in which public constructors provide full activation contexts.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ActivationContext class.
Initializes a new instance of the T:System.ActivationContext class using the specified application identity and array of manifest paths.

content.para: An T:System.ApplicationIdentity object that identifies an application.
A string array of manifest paths for the application.
applicationIdentity is null.
-or-
manifestPaths is null.
No deployment or application identity is specified in applicationIdentity.
-or-
applicationIdentity does not match the identity in the manifests.
-or-
applicationIdentity does not have the same number of components as the manifest paths.

The M:System.ActivationContext.CreatePartialActivationContext(System.ApplicationIdentity,System.String[]) method calls an internal constructor to create a new activation context. The implementation of the T:System.ActivationContext class in the .NET Framework version 2.0 is designed for applications that are neither fully installed in a store nor fully contained a folder. This method provides backward compatibility for later releases in which public constructors provide full activation contexts.

summary.para: Gets the form, or store context, for the current application.

content.para: A manifest-based application might not be installed in the ClickOnce store. Applications not in the store, such as a manifest-activated application executing in vsprvslong, are classified as F:System.ActivationContext.ContextForm.Loose. Applications in the store are classified as F:System.ActivationContext.ContextForm.StoreBounded.

summary.para: Populates a T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo with the data needed to serialize the target object.

content.para: The T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo to populate with data.
The T:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext structure for this serialization.
